definition: to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
to force (sb to do sth)/to compel/to press for/to extort/to press on towards/to press up to/to close in on/euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

sentences.english: The enemy was advancing. The snow was stained with blood.
sentences.chinese: 首都被迫棄守，敵人步步進逼，鮮血將白雪浸染。

sentences.english: Leaning toward each other bit by bit.
The two advanced on him with clenched fists.
sentences.chinese: 這兩人緊握拳頭向他進逼過來。
這兩人緊握拳頭向他進逼過來。
拿破崙的軍隊進逼莫斯科。

sentences.english: The demonstrators fled when soldiers toting machine guns advanced on the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 當持有機槍的士兵向人羣進逼時，示威者逃散了。

sentences.english: He even pushed as far as Embrun.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至敢於進逼昂布倫。

sentences.english: Soldiers moved in on the well-defended old house from all sides.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們從四面八方進逼那所防守嚴密的老房子。

sentences.english: The troops were firing away at the advancing enemy.
sentences.chinese: 部隊連續不斷地向步步進逼的敵人開火。

sentences.english: Enemy troops in overwhelming numbers were converging on the reich .
sentences.chinese: 敵軍正以壓倒優勢的兵力，從四面八方向帝國進逼。
